text: [Music]
in order to combat the threat of climate
change regulators around the world have
imposed costs on firms carbon emissions
in some industries production costs are
projected to increase by 40% for
facilities in the local regulated region
however under existing carbon policy
facilities located outside the local
regulated region are not affected by
these carbon costs as a result emissions
regulation provides foreign firms with a
new source of cost advantage this can
enable foreign firms to increase their
penetration into the domestic regulated
region this carbon based cost advantage
can also encourage domestic firms to
move facilities offshore to avoid carbon
costs this foreign entry and offshoring
are both potential sources of what is
called carbon leakage the displacement
of carbon intensive production from the
regulated domestic region to offshore
locations due to an increase in
emissions price carbon tariffs have been
proposed as a way to prevent this
leakage a carbon tariff is a tax on the
emissions from imported products that
would have incurred carbon costs if they
had been produced in the regulated
region however carbon tariffs have
proven controversial some argue that
carbon tariffs are good environmental
policy
helping to reduce global emissions by
exposing all firms serving the regulated
market to the same carbon costs on the
other hand others argue that carbon
tariffs are intended solely to protect
domestic firms but they are trade
protectionism being disguised as
environmental policy our results weigh
in on this debate we show that domestic
firms profits can increase decrease or
remain unchanged due to a carbon tariffs
this suggests a carbon tariffs general
benefit is not to protect domestic firms
as some argue carbon tariffs are not
inherently protectionist however we show
that carbon tariffs do help reduce
global emissions without a carbon
tariffs emissions regulation has an
adverse effect in many settings without
a carbon tariffs increase
in emissions price can inadvertently
increase global emissions by
incentivizing carbon leakage only with
the addition of a carbon tariff does
emissions price have its intended effect
in all settings with a carbon tariffs
global emissions strictly decrease
across all scenarios as emissions price
increases in other words by improving
the efficacy of emissions regulation
carbon tariffs are effective
